abstract: Hoegh Autoliners, owner of 57,000-ton car transporter Hoegh Osaka now beached on sandbank off British port of Southampton, praises crew for taking swift action to save vessel by running it aground as it began to list; fate of transporter stands in contrast to Cemfjord, bulk-cement carrier that capsized and sank in British waters.
lead_paragraph: The 57,000-ton Hoegh Osaka was run aground on Bramble Bank, a well-marked sandbank off the port of Southampton, to prevent it from capsizing after it began to list.
snippet: The 57,000-ton Hoegh Osaka was run aground on Bramble Bank, a well-marked sandbank off the port of Southampton, to prevent it from capsizing after it began to list.

headline.main: Decks Tilting, Crew Grounded Ship Off Southern England to Save It
headline.print_headline: Decks Tilting, Crew Grounded Ship to Save It
